qas.question: The public hospital that has been around the longest in the US is what?
Who is the president of HHC?
What was the first public hospital founded in the United States?
If the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom becomes sick in New York City, what hospital does he go to?
In what state did the president of HHC previously work?
What was the president of HHC's previous job title?

context: The most well-known hospital in the HHC system is <a0_0><a2_0><a3_0>Bellevue Hospital<a3_0/><a2_0/><a0_0/>, the oldest public hospital in the United States. Bellevue is the designated hospital for treatment of the President of the United States and other world leaders if they become sick or injured while in New York City. The president of HHC is <a1_0><a4_0>Ramanathan Raju<a1_0/>, MD<a4_0/>, a surgeon and former <a6_0>CEO<a6_0/> of the Cook County health system in <a5_0>Illinois<a5_0/>.
